div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

p.a: COVID- 19 Superior Central Continuity of Learning Plan
Superior Central Technology and Internet Accessibility Survey
Event: Exams-1:30 Dismissal (Last Day of School)

div.p: Yesterday the Governor signed EO 2020-48 suspending the monthly meeting requirement for local school boards until May 12, 2020. With that, we will be cancelling our board meeting scheduled for Monday, April 20th. Our next scheduled meeting is for Monday, May 18th. Stay Healthy!

UPDATE ON SAKYLLY'S EGGS! Sakylly's eggs were delivered to the school the day that the Governor issued the "Stay Safe, Stay Home" order. This meant that we did not have time to sort the eggs by teacher, or personalize them. Initially, I thought it would be best to wait out the "lockdown" and get eggs out when we went back to school. Now that Easter is a week away, there has been an increased demand for eggs. If you absolutely need your eggs, Superior Central orders will be available for pick up in the Elementary lot on Thursday, April 9th from noon until 1:00. Please stay in your car, your eggs will be brought to you. In order to fulfill your order, please email Bill Valima at bvalima@superiorcentralschools.org by 3:00 p.m. Tuesday, April 7th. For your order to be processed, you MUST INCLUDE the student/family your purchased your egg from. Please understand that eggs will not have personalized frosted names on them. Parents, if you are picking up your entire order, please let me know. If you can wait until the Governor's "Stay Safe, Stay Home" order is lifted, your eggs will still be available for you. If you would like a refund for your eggs please email me at the above email. Thanks for your patience. Bill Valima

Hey SC Family, Just a reminder that the AC3 group has non-perishable breakfast and lunch food available at the Village Pub and the Silver Dollar right now! They will be distributing until 7:00 tonight. Thanks again to this amazing community for helping out in this crazy time.

All schools in Michigan will be closed for the remainder of the school year. We will begin our alternative learning plan on Wednesday, April 15th. Please continue to check our website for information as well as the Superior Central Facebook page. Stay Safe.
